data.title: What channel is Croatia v Italy Euro 2024 match on? TV coverage, live stream and kick-off time
data.meta_description: Check out how to watch Croatia v Italy in Euro 2024, including TV channel, radio coverage and kick-off time.
data.text:
The Azzuri edged past Albania in their opener and were comfortably beaten by Group B winners Spain, so Luciano Spalletti is likely to demand a reaction from his players

Read more: Euro 2024 matches on today | Euro 2024 TV coverage | Euro 2024 radio coverage

Croatia will take hope from the second-half surge that nearly earned them a victory against Albania, with Klaus Gjasula's 95th-minute winner ensuring the points were shared, while they also had their moments in a 3-0 defeat to Spain in their opener.

More like this

Luka Modrić has warned Italy that his side will play with no fear on Monday night, but time may have finally caught up with Croatia's experienced heads.

RadioTimes.com has rounded up all the details for how to watch Croatia v Italy on TV and online.

Read more: Euro 2024 fixtures | Euro 2024 presenters | Euro 2024 predictions | Euro 2024 group analysis | Euro 2024 team-by-team guide | Euro 2024 kits ranked

When is Croatia v Italy?

Croatia v Italy will take place on Monday 24th June 2024.

Check out our live football on TV guide for the latest times and information.

Croatia v Italy kick-off time

Croatia v Italy will kick off at 8pm.

What TV channel is Croatia v Italy on?

Croatia v Italy will be shown live on BBC One with live coverage from 7:30pm.

Check out the full broadcast teams for both BBC and ITV with our Euro 2024 presenters, pundits and commentators guide.

How to live stream Croatia v Italy online

You can also live stream Croatia v Italy online via BBC iPlayer.

The streaming platform is available on a range of devices, from desktop and laptop computers to smartphones and tablets via the app.

Listen to Croatia v Italy on radio

You can listen to the match on BBC Radio 5 Live.

BBC Radio 5 Live is available on DAB radio, MW 693 kHz, 909 kHz and 990 kHz, or you can tune into the station via most TV packages. You can also listen to Radio 5 Live online via the BBC website or BBC Sounds app.
